casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Doyle D. EDWARDS, Appellant. ED 106771 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, SOUTHERN DIVISION. Filed: April 30, 2019 Michael L. Jackson, Law Offices of Michael L. Jackson, LC, 1028 N. Kingshighway, Suite 1, Cape Girardeau, MO 63701, for appellant. Justin A. Moody, Assistant Attorney General, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102, for respondent. Before Lisa P. Page, C.J., Mary K. Hoff, J., and Philip M. Hess, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Doyle D. Edwards ("Defendant") appeals the trial court's judgment following a bench trial convicting him of one count of second-degree domestic assault pursuant to Section 565.073 RSMo (2016). We affirm.

We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order. The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
